Our waiter was attentive and friendly and the restaurant is decorated beautifully.  My thai ice tea was also one of the best I have had. I would return again!

qvQ9cUUz5DG8l1_5O6mgYg.text: The steamed veggies are the perfect start to summer. However the sticky rice is slightly too sticky, they do give you a decent portion though. The prices seemed to be different online compared to in house, don't rely solely on what you see on your screen - give them a call and they are happy to help!

4CBkiQ093odPM0Xcc-DtVw.text: We are from Kansas visiting to watch our beloved Steelers beat the Browns!!! Everything was delicious and very fresh, highly recommend this place.

f91k2BJyKMgkN79pXuZxZg.text: This restaurant was top notch! The dinning space was clean and nicely decorated.  The food was by far the best part! Everything tasted fresh and was promptly served.  GREAT VEG FRIENDLY RESTAURANT!

JwiXqo2eFBNGSMWJz3c7zg.text: Nobody does a fresh spring roll like Tram's Kitchen, but this Nicky's location comes close.  I had a pre-show dinner with a fellow fabulous Yelper and enjoyed a fresh spring roll and the chicken/mango salad as my meal. At $8.50 for the salad, I wasn't expect anything huge. I was WRONG. The salad is plentiful and amazingly delicious. The tomato was on it's way to rotten and the spice wasn't what I would call a "Five," but aside from that the mango was wonderful and the chicken grilled to perfection. Bonus - when it appeared to our server that I was having trouble reading in the [very] dimly lit dining area, he quickly supplied a mini flashlight. Now that's service. Dangerous having this one block from work..

28H2cb2rNPlqo4TtXG_f6A.text: Used to be our go-to thai spot in downtown. I went a lot last year but tried it twice recently and their quality  has drastically gone down :( the first of the two times, I thought I just caught them on a bad night but the second time confirmed it for me. Their food is now tasteless without siracha, extremely greasy and the noodles are dry and chewy. Both times i forced down the food and eventually had to throw it away because it was inedible :( even the white rice was dry and seemed old. Don't plan to go back anymore.

kZPAeK22spUncQseCkTnow.text: I really love Nicky's Thai! I have only tried the massaman curry and a few appetizers, but everything I have had is very high quality and delicious. If you don't like spice, I don't recommend getting above a five spice level. I usually stick to a six because I like a little bit of spice. Also I definitely recommend dining in rather than take out as you definitely get a larger serving if you dine in.

Z0nb5aXwlcNgUL1y6ns1mg.text: This was the best Thai food I had ever eaten! We were in town for a conference and once we discovered this place we kept on going back, we didn't care if it was lunch, dinner, or if we had more Thai food than we had ever had in a row. We just had to have more. So delicious. My favourite was a vegetarian green curry with mango dish.

AD8KWgGmzz6wAQbxa53IcQ.text: I've only had lunch here but it is the best pad Thai I've ever had.  Always a line but worth the wait.  They need to expand because there is plenty of demand.

63btIhWT4jguUDiGtkLxyw.text: Food wasn't great, service was so so but the most significant reason I wouldn't recommend this place was the noise was utterly deafening. I'm not talking loud, I'm talking ear splitting. If you have any desire to converse, you had better know sign language. Next!

YQQ0ineWA8rLVob3UfEZFQ.text: This place was great! Having been to and love Thailand, this is one of the best to real Thai food we have found around.

_Lbkjti0dOPV4xuS-qR5eQ.text: First time in Pittsburg and saw this resturant wasn't how to find parking due to the road work and parking garages are so expensive. We decided to order through grub hub this is my first time doing this and having it delivered and my experience was by far amazing and the food made it the more better. I will definitely be eating here again before I leave for home. 100% recommend the pat Thai and the beef salad reminds me a lot like my dads cooking, loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef salad and chicken Thai, also got the Thai tea but I finished that before the food came it was delish!!!!!

55yeGx6Qsv_bzhxB8T1pjw.text: My sister made a reservation for 7:00 pm. The service that was provided was great! You can see how well the group worked as a team. Water was constantly filled, dishes were bussed in a timely manner, and going above and beyond our server offered to take the group photo first.  Food for me personally could have been more tangy/tart/sour. I like a heavy hand with kaffir like leaf, lemongrass and galanga.   We ordered the spicy noodles (tofu), duck curry, green curry (chicken), curry noodles (beef), mussels, Tom Kha (seafood). The family were happy with most of the meal except for the mussels. There were shells but a lot of missing mussels. I wouldn't recommend the mussels or the curry noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green curry
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck curry, green curry (chicken), spicy noodle (tofu), curry noodle (beef), Thai fried rice

gFOAzzVcl4vR5E8xAaethQ.text: My favorite Thai food restaurant in Pittsburgh! I ordered the cashew entree and loved it. Firstly, they give you a lot of food. They don't skimp out on veggies, meat, or cashews, so you're able to taste all the different flavors with each bite. Plus I had plenty left over for dinner the following night. Second, the veggies and meat are cooked perfectly. My chicken wasn't chewy and the broccoli, peppers, and onions were seasoned and cooked just right so they weren't too chewy or too soft. The menu has plenty of delicious sounding options to choose from and they are all reasonably priced with the quality and quantity of food you are given.  The restaurant itself is smaller, so I recommend calling ahead and making a reservation, otherwise you might have to wait for seats to open up. Inside is dimly lit and classier than other Thai restaurants I've visited. It feels intimate even though the tables are close to each other. Definitely recommend eating here!

3Oc-ueNFwLLZbKrCm66leQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place since I moved here over a year ago! I was so excited to finally get the chance. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside but the decor inside has been updated and very nice. It's quaint, but very clean and the service was FAST!   My go-to dishes at any Thai restaurant are crab Rangoon and Pad See Ewe. Both were delicious !!!  The portion sizes were perfect, not too big or small. I was bummed to see no edamame on the menu. They also had a small bar at the back of restaurant and I saw many people enjoying bottles of wine with their meal!   If you find yourself in the area - check it out !!!! It's delicious !

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qu8b5WHtzLXYi9y-DYL2Ww.text: my mom and i always order take out here when i visit her in pittsburgh. we use grub hub but the service is still pretty quick! their food is DELICIOUS, you cannot go wrong with the pad thai. be warned, their hot scale is HOT. i can usually handle foods at about a 5 or 6. their scale is 1-5 and 2 has my mouth beginning to burn. 3 makes it almost inedible to me. if you have the palate for spicy food, this is for you. otherwise, order a 1 and add your own spice at home

XdERJ75nG8DU0BHDJ5nakQ.text: This is my favorite Thai food restaurant. All of their curries are amazing. It is definitely their best location and a hidden gem. They are normally really busy which makes complete sense.

5Oi_PJ2hHiR1-GIW1MdUdw.text: Nicky's Thai Kitchen is a beautiful dining experience tucked away in the middle of downtown. I might spend as much time staring at the golden mirrored ornamental designs around me as I do the menu or talking with my friends, which is not to say that the quality of the food is anything less.  I am always impressed by their wide selection of curries, noodles, and appetizers. My favorite dish so far is the panang curry - the notes of lime, basil, and cilantro are soothing and comforting, the right mix of sweet and savory, perfect with a side of rice. Their appetizers are delicious as well - I recommend the deep-fried shrimp cakes which go well with the accompanying light cucumber sauce.   Just writing this review makes me want to go back when I get the chance to have the same exact thing as last time even though there's so many things on the menu I promise myself I'll try next time.

2mEVikJzHsWhUo4MFZUYsg.text: The exterior is not inviting but the interior is full of bling and fun!  I was so impressed with the presentation of all the food being brought to the customers. I had the Crab Rangoon which was so fresh and flavorful! I then ordered the shrimp red curry with a medium spice level. It was so good I ate everything! I would have preferred more heat but I wasn't sure how the chef defined spicy. This is a must and the service is fast!! Great place!

MrJ7MXPO971hfwBYL-Q4FQ.text: Nicky's is probably the one of the best Thai restaurants in the city.  They definitely serve up the best pad thai you can get. I love that you can get delivery and I love that I don't have to go to the northside just to enjoy Nicky's anymore. I've always gotten great service and never had to wait long to be seated here. It is BYOB which is divine because you can surely guzzle down a bottle or two of wine with their spicy foods. They have some really great Crab Rangoon that they throw in for free on deliveries over a certain amount, but I say order it regardless, you won't regret it. Whenever I get that hankering for some spicy noodle dishes or curries I pop into Nickys because I know it's a solid choice and it'll never let you down!

_srLmDJw2SATkesPHk2heg.text: Great and authentic tasting Thai food and a nice environment in downtown Pittsburgh. Had lots of good vegetarian choices, too. Will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

W8xJeuEDpFS_prmbzH7I8g.text: Good Thai food, great crab fried rice and Pad Se Ew. They have 3 locations in the Pittsburgh, the best though is either downtown or in North Hills. My only complaint is they are a little bit pricey, at $22 dollars for the crab fried rice, but the food is always stellar.

TIgNhXMwJdHxY5FiwTD-nA.text: Everything was good this time and the environment is nice and artsy.  My only problem was that my rice was a little dry.....  dry , dry , dry

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dry rice.. . NO
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yV-Y2cM8CXl2cmd--uwpZQ.text: Great flavor, fresh ingredients, big portions and extremely good value! Need I say more!?

_5Ca92HNWLMoT0zOIcy5xw.text: My wife and I stopped by for dinner at this little Thai restaurant on Penn Avenue in Pittsburgh. I must say that this place was awesome. I ordered the Tom Yum soup and it was huge for $4.50. The soup was delicious and enough for both of us. My wife got the Spring Roll deluxe that had both egg rolls and spring rolls. We liked the egg roll better, but they were both great. I ordered the vegetable pad Thai and my wife got the spicy veggie peanut with white rice. The pad Thai was good, but the spicy peanut was outstanding. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tom Yum soup
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Peanut with rice
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spring Roll Delux Dinner

Buh5x56z8aOK05kn49njbw.text: I would love to have a graph for my review of Nicky's. When I first went there and for several times after, it was amazing (5-stars). I've continued to be a customer of theirs for many years. I must say it has gone downhill. You get a lot of sauce with little meat and veggies. The servers are not as friendly as they once were. You are not often greeted in a friendly fashion. Sometimes there is a bad timing issue; appetizer and food come too close or entree takes forever to come out.  So you may say, why do you still go back? Well, because it used to be really good and I'm hoping it will be again.  However, the last time we were there was the last time. My son (an visual artist) was sitting against the wall, I on the chair opposite him. Our meals arrived. The server put my dish down then handed my son his dish. The server did not indicate the temperature of the plate. It was very hot. My son dropped it onto the table (his hand hurt for a long period of time). The server walked away. Management did not come to apologize (nor did the server). I asked to speak to the manager and someone came over. I explained what happened. She said, "I'll make sure that doesn't happen again."

f-kjX-onX9l3eOlrrIU_3Q.text: Came here for dinner with a group from work. Had a reservation and were seated immediately.   We ordered a handful of appetizers for the table to start. They came out at different times. They were ok. Nothing spectacular. Dumplings ok and the spring rolls are ok. Same with drinks. We ordered drinks but they took awhile to show up.   Everyone ordered something different. I got a chefs special drunken chicken. It's was a crispy chicken with assorted veggies and wonton soup in a brown sauce. The sauce was a bit salty. Chicken was a nice piece but it wasn't very tender. And the veggies were undercooked just a bit. Soup was good.   Everyone else did seem to like their dinner. I was just underwhelmed. Service was spotty. No parking. Just ok.

C-hTkICwVUQbfWLnCmBDBQ.text: The food is not bad.  The service was way below par.  The cleanliness was disturbing.  We saw a water glass has fingerprints on it.  We told our waitress and made an off the cuff comment and swapped with the next table.  When she filled my glass water from the bottom off the pitcher was dripping in my plate.  I put my hands out to catch the water and verbally notified her.  She continued pouring and rolled her eyes.  At that point I was too scared to eat.  When the bill came out I was over charged by 3$.  I paid it and got the hell out.  The 2 stars are for the chef.

BawJI-_XCZ_KX0a1gmQlhg.text: I am in Pittsburgh on business and my supervisor recommended I try Nicky's Thai Kitchen. I was really glad that I did! I ordered the Crispy Spring Rolls to start and the Spicy Green Bean w/ tofu. It was all delicious and the portion was very filling - I couldn't finish the dish and the rice even though I wanted to. Great food, great service, great value for your money. I will definitely be back and recommend to my colleagues.

aCk6nughyjr0Rbn9_xcpig.text: Yummy, fresh, and very affordable. The staff is kind, attentive, and efficient. The menu has lots to offer. My dish came with a carb Rangoon garnish. Who doesn't love a bonus Rangoon? The dining room is beautifully decorated (especially when compared to the modest exterior). I highly recommend Nicky's.

q-uEdmR9NYZzcfFMa6G6tw.text: I can't believe I'd never reviewed this restaurant - we've been here quite a few times and I think the food and service are both wonderful. I definitely recommend Nicky's if you're looking for a place to eat downtown.   If you're out of the city, their location in Wexford is just as great, much bigger, and offers outdoor dining along with free parking...

DQ7EnF0iiaV_jjBEmd6Yhg.text: I'm a Thai food fiend, and I've had a lot of bad Thai food in my day, but man, this place is GOOD! They have specials all the time and combos so you can try a lot of good things without breaking the bank. I also love this place because it's rarely ever crowded or requires a wait. This is my go to spot when I want good food, I'm starving, and don't want to wait too long.

D6hgxpclrxSHmez4hPxxCA.text: I met a friend here for dinner on a Friday night. Do yourself a favor and make reservations! The place is decorated nicely and has lots of culture on the walls.  One star loss for service- just my server. The rest of the staff seemed great. He was just not keeping up. Look, I don't demand much, but when I have to beg for a refill and I'm eating an 8 out of 10 level spicy meal...please, PLEASE keep the cup full. :)  I ordered the Tiger Cry Beef for an appetizer and it was freaking amazing. Perfectly cooked.  As my meal I ordered the Green Curry Mango Salmon. Looks like a sloppy mess- taste was on par. It was served with a side of rice but it didn't need it. It was very tasty- and relatively healthy if you don't eat the whole dang plate, but fair warning, that will be tough.

cQLLQWcDFKFh_Td19G0mrw.text: It's been so long that I had amazing Thai food. This place has it all. The traditional items that you'd expect and then some very interesting creations. Small and a little cramped but so yummy. I wished they open another open over in Jefferson Hills.

8DZ725pW9ubJNQQra4t74Q.text: Great food - the curry and vegan duck taste great. very nice store decoration and the dish plates are very fancy

0rca4MfT_FCInqHUvimu_g.text: So we were craving Thai food so my brother brought us to the "best" Thai restaurant in town. When we ordered our waitress had limited knowledge about the dishes on the menu. We asked if the coconut juice was fresh or canned and she said not fresh or canned. So we ordered one glass of it. For appetizers we got chicken satay. I've been to Malaysia and Singapore so I know my satay. This was NOT satay! It was boiled chicken on a stick! No grill marks.   When we tried the coconut juice and it was pure sugar. So we asked our waitress to change it for a coconut mojito instead and her response was "we can't". You can't change our drink for something else we want and will pay for??? She walked away and never returned to our table to ask about the food. Such awful service!!!  The food was so underwhelming!!  Don't fall into the trap of the reviews if you're a real Thai food connoisseur!

JsylAixFFk0GOqv4LLRMAQ.text: The best thing about this restaurant is the bald guy who refilled my water everytime it got low. Other than that it's best to just stay away from this restaurant. My boyfriend got food poisoning and the staff was very rude. It took forever just to get our order taken and we only got silverware after asking 3 different people. So yeah, just stay away from this place.

YVYwoJLQF6g6Fo5O1l_rTw.text: Great flavor. Very reasonably priced. Gets very crowded so get there early during lunch. Nice setting

_D4EnwdV-FaKGXXLyHCKPg.text: Good food, nice staff. I asked for their vegan options and the host provided a solid list of options. I would have given it a 5 if my meal wasn't so oily. Each piece of tofu was super huge and hard to cut with a fork due to the breading used for frying.

NcE10QHh2nv8tiivWppXYA.text: Fantastic, always a good go to when craving Thai. I do however wish that the services was a little slower, I know that's probably a strange statement. Sometimes feels a little rushed, but hey it's my FAVORITE Thai in Pittsburgh so I will keep coming back!

jumARLHOiHikVcU8QgamDA.text: I'm never disappointed when I go to Nicky's for lunch. We arrive promptly at 11:40 because the place gets packed super quick and its small-ish inside.   I ordered the Thai Style Fried Rice with chicken. I got a Thai 6 for the spice level. I like spicy food and have gotten a 9 there before. The rice was a generous portion. I ate a little over half and took the rest to go. I really enjoyed the large chunks of green onion and the slices of chicken. The salad my meal came with was also delicious. It had the perfect amount of dressing and the mango was fresh.   I didn't get an appetizer this time, but when I do, I go with the crab Rangoon. It's amazing! One comes with your meal, but who can eat only one!?   This restaurant is also great for take out. If you're running late to lunch or even if you want grab something after you leave a happy hour downtown, it's perfect. I ordered it once and it was ready in less than 30 minutes.   Overall, Nicky's has the best Thai in Pittsburgh!

VcTeyqb7grTEU22WILVcVQ.text: Great first time. I got the small coconut soup with chicken level 4 spicy. I was also going to get a noodle dish or something but they had a free appetizer and I was stuffed off just the side soup & app. But the soup was soooooooo good. & I ordered a side of rice instead of the main dishes and the portion was huge. I will definitely come back for the dinner dishes next time. But already so happy with the few things I had. The service is also great. In total my check was like 8$. Like what????

py0y8FWBqFgj_Q-A8KRqLA.text: This place has a beautiful interior and a quick-to-help staff; however, the food is not very consistent. One day you can get very good, authentic-tasting Thai food, and next week it could be something very different. Their spice levels are pretty accurate and tolerable. Being downtown, parking may be an issue, but there is a parking garage right up the street which is pretty big and about a 2 minute walk away from the restaurant!

orwSWBuL4qdRRQm8b0Mx1w.text: There's a reason why this place is always packed to the gills by noon (even on a weekend) and gets its rep for the best Thai food in Pittsburgh.  I came here with a group and we were seated surprisingly quickly for how busy it was.  I got a nice and spicy curry, and cooled it down with a Thai iced tea.  I have zero complaints about it; it was absolutely delicious and I'm glad that they didn't condescend on that spice.  (Sometimes restaurants around here think you really want a 3 when you legitimately ask for a 7 or 8!)  The service was friendly and quick too.  For a downtown office worker, I don't stop by to at least get take out  nearly as often as I should be doing.

_REaKw9J8S0hECxCz0w9KQ.text: Go here. So much food for the price! Authentic Thai food with True spice levels. I got the red curry with tofu and extra veggies. Made friends with my server - great customer service from everyone. Quick seating for a table for one. Stumbled across this gem while strolling around the city after an out of state work training.  I wish I lived in Pittsburgh for so many reasons - Nicky's is one of them and I'd be here every day if I did indeed live in Pittsburgh!

AanaAjtBD-QxAtAFAvR-RQ.text: Service excellent. Unfortunately chef does not understand when we said 'no basil'. Quite the allergic reaction-no compensation. Left in hurry to take Benadryl

4ru0QatOG0bb66IjmUbZ9g.text: If I am in the Cultural District for anything at all, I usually swing by Nicky's Thai first. The food is good and the portions are large, especially for the price. My husband and I can generally split an appetizer and an entree and have more than enough food (but we'll get our own in the name of next-day leftovers) and it's a really nice setting for a date night. I love the decor of this location, too! The staff is always friendly and the service is incredibly fast. The menu is also very large.

oiNA9sDqZcjSIShxUvvfwg.text: Great little Thai restaurant. It's loud at lunch but we'll worth it. The currys are all fantastic. Service is quick. The place is clean. Prices good. Try it out! Oh, btw I just had the vegan duck curry. Absolutely delicious And to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan duck curry after I&#39;m done eating it. I swear you&#39;ve go to try this. I was tempted to like the bowl but composed myself and reframed.

YozrqQL-gLgchaz64ipVuA.text: One the best Thai meals I have had hands down!! This is my first time to Nicky's and while parking is a pain, the food makes up for it. My 5 star rating is explained below on the basis of service, proportion of food, taste, quality and overall experience.  We went there at 10 p.m. on a Saturday, which was almost closing time. I have found that you get very good service around closing but on the flip side, you are rushed a bit and the staff starts cleaning around you.  Anyways, once seated we looked over the menu and made our selections (drinks aside). We got the Thai Roti as an appetizer, which was fried dough with curry and peanut dips, served with lettuce and carrot garnishing. One plate was well portioned for 4 people. While delicious, I was hoping to get some more curry rather than just a miserly dip-sized bowl.  On to the entrees: we ordered the Red Curry with fish (extra spicy), Basil Fried Rice with chicken and shrimp (medium spicy), Gap rap Lad Kao with chicken (medium spicy) and the Siracha Noodles with chicken (medium spicy). While their medium spicy was pretty hot, I really enjoyed the Red Curry too - a real good sweat!! The fish and vegetables in the curry were not an afterthought, and the curry flavors had permeated very well into them.   The Basil Fried Rice was tasty in its own way. I got the strong basil flavor and the spice level was perfect. I usually find the meat in the rice and noodles to be pretty bland, but not in this case. Very well flavored again and in the right proportion.  Siracha Noodles were flat noodles with hot Siracha sauce. I did find the noodles to be a little mushy (overcooked) in places but maybe that was just me being too nit-picky. Again a great noodle dish and it was not too spicy (atleast for my taste buds).  Another star entree was the Gap rap Lad Kao. It had minced chicken on top of boiled white rice, and a fried egg decorating the dish. If you mixed everything well, each bite was delectable and it definitely had some punch to it. I was afraid that the white rice would dim the spice and flavors but I was surprised with each and every bite. Truly, another awesome dish on the menu.  I have to say, the portions were huge, the flavors were plentiful and the service was prompt. We probably got our meal in 15 mins (closing time means faster service), but we did not feel rushed at all. A pleasant 5 star dining experience, coupled with elaborate decor. I look forward to visiting the other location and comparing my experience at Nicky's.

photos.caption: Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Red curry
Photo of Nicky's Thai Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ok93xj5EpN1bRodLmVn0pg.text: If I could rate this place a zero, I would. They can never get my food correct whenever I go there. If I order something spicy but at a bare minimum level, they magically make it the hottest level possible. It's quite frankly annoying, especially me only going there 3 times.

odSsUv1vh8hxEbJoG4RkDQ.text: This place used to be my favorite! My coworkers and I often went for lunch. Unfortunately, the spice levels have become very inconsistent, especially if you order a 3 (out of 5). The biggest disappointment though is how insanely long it has taken us to get our food the last few times. Twice, we ordered take-out and waited an hour! (for only 2 dishes!)

wAQwMk_q3NiEg-trh4loOg.text: Service seemed to be pretty good and the restaurant overall was clean and comfortable.  I started out with the fresh spring rolls.  They're a little different at this restaurant...vegetarian using tofu in lieu of shrimp and crab.  Somewhat dry and tasteless.  Then I had the seafood Tum Yum soup.  It was ok, again not the best I've had...somewhat salty and lacked some of the typical flavors I've had at other Thai restaurants, i.e. Light on the lime juice and too heavy on the fish sauce.  Finally, I had the grilled Squid...not very good at all...overlooked, not much of it and unimpressive dressing.  Sorry folks...not very impressed with this place.

3n98-huDGqBEsNKdwBDhPQ.text: This is, by far, the best Thai food I've had.  I've been to many Thai restaurants, and Nicky's Thai kitchen absolutely leads the pack.  Nice decor, excellent service, and the selection and quality of the food is amazing.  There's very little signage, so finding it is tricky, but you'll be rewarded for your efforts.  The appetizers are excellent, and each of the several entrees I've had are excellent.    Great spot!

BwDn8JlveSPdDblBlEXUnA.text: Surprisingly good Thai food for Downtown Pittsburgh. The spicy Mussels were right on the money and the beer was reasonably priced as well...

2sHrEeFSjjoVrelV2PsBYA.text: Affordable good food. Was packed when we came here, lunch time on a Tuesday. We were able to get a table tho in less than 5 minutes. We ordered curry. Wild curry (real spicy) and green curry (sweet) The restaurant looks very Thai and the only down side is the noise. You can barely hear yourself. All in all tho, good good good food and affordable. The salad that comes as appetizer with the curry was very good too! I would come back again and again if I lived in Pittsburgh but I don't huhu So yeah, definitely a must try if you're craving for Asian food.

Uwb7VOTccsDE4P8wsdm3jg.text: Really great atmosphere and always busy! I try something new each time and it's always amazing. The red curry, see yew, and sweet and sour chicken are great! I will definitely be back !

I6-SDB9YwegeGZzcLekD_A.text: Great service! My water glass was never empty. Friendly staff and delicious lunch. A must when downtown.

22lff6n-mKQu6hkA9VtIRA.text: Just arrived in Pittsburg and yelped this Thai restaurant which is walking distance from hotel. Crowded even at around 9pm on a Sat. Ordered the shrimp cake, basil mussels, green curry and lad nah. They were all DELICIOUS! I'm Asian and have had my fair share of Thai food from Bangkok. I must say this is close to authentic except for the spice level. BUT, you can always choose spice level 10 :)

nP6Nhmx_6u0s2tv3Lhp3yw.text: The thai fried rice is really good except for the fact that I had explosive diarrhea the following hour

M0lwhA3eB1uVZdYukmL4Ng.text: I would have given four stars but they lost a star at the end. The food was very delicious as always. I had the pineapple curry with shrimp. My girlfriend had the wild curry. My suggestion is when ordering your heat level remember to take into account if your curry is sweet or not. This effects the end result. The food is good and the service was above par. The only thing is when we got the remainder of the food to go they wrapped our curry and rice together in a to go bowel instead of separate. This gave me a rice curry soup when I got home. Not a good practice in my opinion.

k7ZLKEYN0L3HcA4FSoLfIA.text: Pretty good Thai food and was decently priced for lunch.  The line was out the door and we had no reservation however we were seated relatively quickly and go our food pretty fast.  They allow you to pick spice level from 1-10.  I of course got 10 and it was nice and hot.  I had the jalapeno peanut dish with tofu.  It was great!

NlB48g9dgCD_cJLZ0ULebA.text: Food was good but a little too spicy for the medium spice level. Not as fresh as I'd like today, but I've been here before when it was better. Had tofu eggplant basil which a little oily. Place was packed for lunch and very LOUD. Table setting is very cramped. Would come back. Hopefully better next time.
